title: IDFC First Bank shares: Is this a stock to buy on Monday after strong Q3 YoY growth? | Stock Market News - Mint
10 top multi-bagger stocks that gave handsome returns in 2024 - CNBCTV18
summary:
10 top multi-bagger stocks that gave handsome returns in 2024: Do you own any of these?

Publication Date: 2024
Source: CNBC-TV18

This article highlights the best performing multi-bagger stocks of 2024, which have delivered substantial returns to their investors. While it does not recommend investing in these stocks, it provides valuable insights into their performance and fundamentals.

  • Shakti Pumps - Surged over six-fold in 2024, with a 23% growth in net profit.
  • Waaree Renewable Technologies - Achieved a remarkable return of 2,024% since 2021.
  • Garware Hi-Tech Films - Gained 113% in 2023 and 347% over five years.
  • Ganesh Housing Corporation - Grew nearly 4000% since 2021.
  • Insolation Energy Ltd - From ₹38 in 2022 to ₹3573.80 in 2024.
  • Balu Forge Industries - Increased market capitalisation significantly with a 141% profit growth in FY24.
  • Piccadily Agro Industries - Saw 552% returns in 2023.
  • Shaily Engineering Plastics - Stock soared by 328% last year.
  • Shilchar Technologies - Increased from ₹500 to ₹8429.30, a major turnaround.
  • Jeena Sikho Lifecare - Stock grew 352% in 2023 and 260% in 2024.
“The market capitalization of these companies was below ₹5,000 crore at the beginning of 2024, and now they have turned into mid-cap firms.”

With the ongoing bull run in India's equity markets, these companies clearly demonstrate successful growth strategies and solid fundamentals, making them noteworthy for investors.
newTitle: Top Multi-Bagger Stocks of 2024: A Profitable Investment Insight

title: Here is why Suzlon Energy shares will be in focus on Monday - CNBCTV18
summary:
Suzlon Energy Shares Set to Attract Attention on Monday

Publication date: [Insert Date] Source: CNBCTV18

Suzlon Energy Ltd.'s shares are poised to be in focus on the upcoming trading session due to a recent demand from the Ahmedabad Income Tax Department.

  • The company has received an Income Tax demand of ₹1.01 crore for FY2017.
  • This demand is linked to a penalty concerning late payments related to employee contributions to PF/ESI during FY 2016-17.
  • Suzlon plans to appeal the penalty and is optimistic about a favorable resolution.
  • The Income Tax Department had previously waived a total penalty of ₹260.35 crore for earlier dues, following a favorable ruling by the ITAT.
  • Shares closed down by 1.38% on the previous Friday, at ₹62.05, but have appreciated over 60% in the past year.
Suzlon Energy: "We are confident of achieving a favorable outcome from the appeal."

The market will be watching Suzlon Energy closely as it navigates this tax issue, particularly given its recent performance and the implications for investor confidence.
newTitle: Suzlon Energy Shares Set to Attract Attention on Monday

  • Both SUVs may feature dual-screen displays, 6 airbags, and ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems).
  • The Hyundai Creta Electric is expected to include dual-zone AC and V2L (Vehicle-to-Load) capabilities, giving it an edge over the Maruti e Vitara.

  • Both vehicles will share safety features like multiple airbags and a 360-degree camera.
“The Creta Electric is expected to undercut the Maruti’s EV by up to Rs 5 lakh.”

These new electric SUVs will compete with other models such as the Tata Curvv EV and the Mahindra BE 6.

title: RBI grants approval to HDFC Bank to acquire up to 9.50% stake in AU Small Finance Bank - CNBCTV18
summary:
RBI Grants Approval to HDFC Bank to Acquire Up to 9.50% Stake in AU Small Finance Bank

Publication Date: January 3, 2025 Source: CNBC TV18

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has granted approval for HDFC Bank to acquire up to 9.50% stake in AU Small Finance Bank, and also to acquire similar stakes in Kotak Mahindra Bank and Capital Small Finance Bank.

  • HDFC Bank must complete the acquisition within one year from the approval date to retain the approval.
  • The approval covers HDFC Bank and its group entities, including several subsidiaries.
  • HDFC Bank is also cleared to maintain aggregate holdings across specified banks without exceeding 9.50%.
“If the acquisition is not completed within this period, the approval will be cancelled,” said AU Small Finance Bank in an exchange filing.

This move signals strategic growth for HDFC Bank through expansions and partnerships within the Indian banking sector.
newTitle: RBI Approves HDFC Bank's Acquisition of Stake in AU Small Finance Bank

title: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Status: Is It Out Yet? Steps To Check Allotment Status Online, Check GMP - News18
summary:
Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Status: Is It Out Yet?

Last Updated: January 04, 2025, 14:39 IST

The allotment of the Indo Farm Equipment IPO is eagerly awaited as registrars are delayed due to heavy subscription bids. The latest grey market premium (GMP) stands at 46.05%, indicating a strong listing expected on January 7.

  • IPO was open from December 31 to January 2.
  • Subscription level was 227.67 times overall.
  • Retail category subscribed 101.79 times, NII portion 501.75 times, QIB category 242.4 times.
  • Profit for investors as unlisted shares trade at Rs 314, Rs 99 higher than IPO price of Rs 215.
The IPO has a size of Rs 260 crore with shares listed on BSE and NSE.

This IPO's success indicates strong market interest and positive investor sentiment ahead of its listing.
newTitle: Indo Farm Equipment IPO Allotment Status: Is It Out Yet? Steps To Check Allotment Status Online, Check GMP

title: Yes Bank share: Is this a stock to buy after Q3 update? EXPLAINED | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Yes Bank share: Is this a stock to buy after Q3 update? EXPLAINED

Published on: January 1, 2025 | Source: Live Mint

After the announcement of Yes Bank's Q3 update, shares experienced strong buying interest, attributed to a significant rise in deposits and loans.

  • 14.6% YoY increase in deposits, now at ₹2.77 lakh crore.
  • 12.6% YoY rise in loans and advances, currently at ₹2.45 lakh crore.
  • CASA deposits surged by 27.6% YoY to ₹91,575 crore.
  • Market analysts expect potential upward movement in stock price, targeting ₹22 soon.
“Investors should maintain a strict stop-loss on a closing basis while monitoring the overall market direction.” - Sugandha Sachdeva

In summary, Yes Bank shows positive growth signs, yet caution is advised as market volatility remains a factor.

title: How to become rich with SBI's New Recurring Deposit Scheme? EXPLAINED | Mint - Mint
summary:
How to Become Rich with SBI's New Recurring Deposit Scheme: Explained

Date: Not specified   Source: Live Mint

The State Bank of India has launched two new deposit schemes, Har Ghar Lakhpati and SBI Patrons, aimed at enhancing financial flexibility for customers.

  • Har Ghar Lakhpati helps customers accumulate ₹1,00,000 or its multiples through a pre-calculated Recurring Deposit scheme.
  • This scheme is available to minors for encouraging early savings.
  • The minimum tenure for the recurring deposits is 12 months, and the maximum is 120 months.
  • SBI Patrons is a specialized Term Deposit product for senior citizens aged 80 years or above, offering enhanced interest rates.
  • SBI Patrons depositors will earn an additional 10 basis points over the normal senior citizen rates.
  • A digital onboarding process for NRE and NRO accounts has been introduced for NRIs, improving account opening efficiency.
“We aim to create goal-oriented deposit products that enhance financial returns and align with our customers' aspirations.” - CS Setty, Chairman of SBI

In conclusion, SBI's new deposit schemes are designed to foster financial inclusion and empower customers towards achieving their financial goals.
newTitle: How to Become Rich with SBI's New Recurring Deposit Scheme Explained

title: Gold price hits two-week high on safe-haven demand. US Fed rate cut, Donald Trump's 2.0 policies in focus | Stock Market News - Mint
summary:
Gold price hits two-week high on safe-haven demand. US Fed rate cut, Donald Trump’s 2.0 policies in focus

Publication Date: Recent

Source: Live Mint

The yellow metal has continued its impressive performance in 2024, driven by safe-haven demand amid geopolitical tensions and economic uncertainties.

Key points:

  • Gold prices have increased by over 0.74% in the international market.
  • Expectations of policy changes under President-elect Donald Trump are impacting gold demand.
  • Central banks worldwide purchased around 740 tonnes of gold in 2024.
  • Gold's gains are being moderated by a strengthening US dollar.
  • Analysts predict that geopolitical and economic uncertainty will continue to support gold demand.
“The recent surge in gold prices has been primarily driven by its appeal as a safe-haven asset amid escalating geopolitical tensions.” - Sugandha Sachdeva

In conclusion, while a stronger dollar may pose challenges for gold prices, the prevailing uncertainties in both domestic and international markets suggest that demand for gold is likely to remain strong in the near future.
newTitle: Gold Prices Surge Amid Safe-Haven Demand and Political Uncertainties

title: Zepto plans IPO filing by March-April; Singapore nod in for moving domicile - The Economic Times
summary:
Zepto Plans IPO Filing by March-April; Moves Domicile to India

Publication Date: No date provided Source: ETtech

Zepto is preparing to file for an IPO by March-April 2025 and has received approval to move its holding entity from Singapore to India. The company is also finalising independent directors and deliberating on IPO size and bankers.

  • In advanced discussions to file draft documents for IPO.
  • Received approval to shift domicile from Singapore to India.
  • Aiming to become the first independent quick commerce firm to go public.
  • Finalizing independent directors as part of the IPO process.
  • Plans to raise at least $450 million, subject to change.
“We’re 100% compliant with the country’s FDI regulations and have been since day one. But we’re also rapidly moving towards having local ownership of our company.” - Aadit Palicha, CEO

Zepto's move to India comes amid scrutiny over compliance with local FDI regulations. The company aims to position itself favorably in the competitive landscape.
newTitle: Zepto Plans IPO Filing by March-April; Moves Domicile to India

title: Diversifying assets: RBI strategy has a heart of gold - The Economic Times
summary:
Diversifying assets: RBI strategy has a heart of gold

Publication Date: November 29, 2024 Source: Economic Times

The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is intensifying its gold purchases as a strategy to diversify its foreign exchange reserves and reduce currency volatility.

  • The RBI bought 20 tonnes of gold from October to November.
  • Cumulative gold purchases in FY25 have reached 50 tonnes.
  • Gold's share in India's foreign exchange reserves exceeds 10%, one of the highest among major central banks.
  • RBI's gold reserves stand at 876.18 tonnes.
  • Gold prices have risen by 19% this financial year but remained stable during RBI's increased purchases.
“The buying of gold by central banks is driven by the need to diversify assets in which forex reserves are held.” - Gaura Sengupta, Chief Economist at IDFC Bank

Furthermore, the RBI rarely sells gold, highlighting its strategic importance in reserve management.
newTitle: RBI Increases Gold Purchases to Diversify Assets and Mitigate Risks

title: Refinancing on agenda, Reliance raises dual currency loan of $3 billion - The Economic Times
summary:
Reliance Raises $3 Billion Dual Currency Loan

Date: Mumbai, Source: Economic Times

Reliance Industries has successfully secured a $3 billion loan from 11 banks, marking the largest loan deal by the company in nearly two years. The funds will primarily be used to refinance loans maturing in 2025.

  • The five-year loan includes $450 million in Japanese yen.
  • The deal was priced at 120 basis points above the three-month secured overnight financing rate (SOFR).
  • Major banks involved include Bank of America, DBS Bank, and HSBC.
  • Reliance has drawn down about $700 million from the loan so far.
  • Further syndication of the loan is anticipated to attract more banks later this quarter.
“Almost all of the money raised will be used to refinance loans which are maturing in 2025.”

This loan not only showcases Reliance's strong market position but also reflects confidence among lenders despite the upcoming financial obligations.
newTitle: Reliance Raises $3 Billion Dual Currency Loan to Refinance Upcoming Debts

title: FDIC Took Issue With Banks Using Public Blockchains Like Ethereum, FOIA Docs Reveal - Decrypt
summary:
FDIC Took Issue With Banks Using Public Blockchains Like Ethereum, FOIA Docs Reveal

Publication Date: Recent Disclosure, Source: Coinbase

American banks have been discouraged by the FDIC from utilizing public blockchain networks to offer services, according to documents obtained via the Freedom of Information Act. These revelations come from unredacted letters exchanged between the FDIC and member banks.

  1. FDIC has expressed concerns over banks using public blockchains like Ethereum instead of private networks.
  2. Regulatory bodies are pushing for detailed review processes before banks can launch products on public blockchains.
  3. Other letters indicate the FDIC has ordered banks to pause all crypto asset-related activities.
  4. Coinbase's legal officer claims these efforts are part of a wider governmental initiative against the cryptocurrency sector.
“They show a coordinated effort to stop a wide variety of crypto activity,” - Paul Grewal, Coinbase Chief Legal Officer.

This situation highlights tension between federal regulators and the expanding crypto industry, raising questions about the future of blockchain integration in traditional banking.
newTitle: FDIC Discourages Banks From Using Public Blockchains for Services

title: Airbus delivered about 760 jets in 2024, 10 short of annual goal, Bloomberg News reports - Reuters
EPFO ATM Card And Mobile App: Launch Date, Withdrawal Limits Revealed - News18
summary:
EPFO ATM Card And Mobile App: Launch Date, Withdrawal Limits Revealed

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: News18

Union Labour and Employment Minister, Mansukh Mandaviya, has announced that a new Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) mobile application and debit card facility will be available to subscribers by May-June. This will streamline the withdrawal process significantly.

  • The EPFO ATM card will not allow full contribution withdrawal but simplifies access to funds.
  • Work on EPFO 2.0 (IT system upgrade) is nearly complete and will precede the launch of EPFO 3.0.
  • The new system aims to centralise claim settlements.
  • Ongoing discussions between the RBI and Finance Ministry to facilitate banking services for EPFO subscribers.
  • Withdrawals will be subject to a limit and do not require prior approval from the EPFO.
“During the Modi government’s tenure from 2014 to 2024, 17.19 crore individuals secured employment.”

This initiative by the government aims to ease the withdrawal process for EPFO subscribers and improve employment opportunities.
newTitle: EPFO ATM Card And Mobile App: Launch Date, Withdrawal Limits Revealed

title: Civil, criminal cases against Gautam Adani assigned to one judge: New York court order - The Hindu
summary:
Civil, criminal cases against Gautam Adani assigned to one judge: New York court order

Published: January 04, 2025 01:21 am IST | Source: The Hindu

A New York court has ordered that the criminal and civil cases filed against billionaire Gautam Adani and others involved in a bribery scheme are deemed related and will be assigned to the same judge overseeing the criminal case.

  • The U.S. District Court in New York determined that all cases are based on similar allegations arising from the same events.
  • Criminal charges include conspiracies to commit securities fraud linked to significant bribery claims involving solar power contracts.
  • The Adani Group denies all allegations, claiming they are baseless and asserting their commitment to legal compliance.
  • Legal actions have been reassigned to United States District Judge Nicholas Garaufis.
“The allegations made by the US Department of Justice and the US Securities and Exchange Commission against directors of Adani Green are baseless and denied.” - Adani Group spokesperson

In summary, the cases against Gautam Adani highlight serious legal challenges involving allegations of corruption linked to major financial dealings.
newTitle: Civil, criminal cases against Gautam Adani assigned to one judge: New York court order

title: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD eases on Friday as investors look elsewhere - FXStreet
summary:
Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD Dips Below $2,650 as Market Sentiment Shifts

Publication Date: January 5, 2025 | Source: FXStreet

XAU/USD dipped on Friday, with gold prices falling roughly two-thirds of a percent and dipping back below $2,650 per ounce as market sentiment recovers from the early week’s risk-off appetite.

  • Gold bids cooled back below $2,650, crimping the week’s gains.
  • Market risk appetite recovered with improved US ISM data.
  • Federal Reserve's Barkin soothes investor concerns on interest rates and tariffs.
“Markets shouldn’t be too worried about a potential 10%-20% fee on all imported goods into the US.” - Tom Barkin

With upcoming economic events like the Nonfarm Payrolls print, market participants are closely watching how gold prices will react to broader economic trends.
newTitle: Gold Price Forecast: XAU/USD Dips Below $2,650 as Market Sentiment Shifts

title: SBI, HDFC Bank raise FD rates for segments like seniors above 80 - The Times of India
summary:
SBI and HDFC Bank Increase FD Rates for Seniors Over 80

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Economic Times

India's leading financial institutions, SBI and HDFC Bank, have announced an increase in fixed deposit (FD) rates for senior citizens, specifically targeting those aged 80 and above. This decision is aimed at providing better returns on investments for older customers during a time of rising inflation.

  • SBI raised the FD interest rate for senior citizens from 6.50% to 6.75%.
  • HDFC Bank increased the maximum interest rate on certain FDs to 7.25% for seniors.
  • This move reflects the banks' response to improving market conditions and aims to attract more deposits.
  • Senior citizens are often considered a priority segment due to their reliance on fixed incomes.
"We strive to provide financial security to our senior customers through competitive interest rates on fixed deposits." - SBI spokesperson

Both banks see this increase as a strategic move to bolster their FD portfolios while ensuring that senior citizens have access to better financial products.
newTitle: SBI and HDFC Bank Increase FD Rates for Seniors Over 80

title: Mark Mobius Says Weaker Rupee To Help Export-Oriented Companies, Trump 2.0 To Benefit India - News18
PNB Revises FD Interest Rates, Introduces Two Tenures; Check Latest Interest Rates - News18
summary:
PNB Revises FD Interest Rates, Introduces Two Tenures; Check Latest Interest Rates

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: News18

State-owned Punjab National Bank (PNB) has revised its fixed deposit (FD) interest rates, introducing new tenures effective January 1, 2025. The new 303-day FD offers 7% interest, while the 506-day FD offers 6.7% for general citizens.

  • PNB's FD interest rates range from 3.5% to 7.25% for tenures of 7 days to 10 years.
  • The highest rate of 7.25% is applicable for a 400-day tenure.
  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman urges banks to improve deposit mobilization for sustainable credit growth.
“While credit growth has picked up, mobilisation of deposits could further be improved to fund the credit growth sustainably.” - Nirmala Sitharaman

This revision aims to attract more deposits, reflecting efforts to enhance customer relationships and ensure efficient service delivery.
newTitle: PNB Adjusts FD Rates with New Tenures Effective January 2025

title: Vedanta Q3 Business Updates: Aluminium Production Up 3%, Zinc Down 2% - NDTV Profit
summary:
Vedanta Q3 Business Updates: Aluminium Production Up 3%, Zinc Down 2%

Publication Date: Recent Release | Source: Vedanta Business Updates

Vedanta Ltd. has reported an increase in aluminium production of 3% year-on-year, totaling 614 kilotonne for the third quarter. The company also highlighted an impressive nine-month production performance across various metal categories.

  • Aluminium production rose 3% to 614 kt.
  • Mined metal production increased 3% to 265 kt, driven by improvements at Agucha and Zawar mines.
  • Refined zinc production also saw a 3% sequential increase to 204 kt.
  • Oil and gas production declined 19% year-on-year to 9.1 million barrels of oil equivalent per day.
  • Pig iron production increased by 7% to 217 kt.
  • Total saleable steel production rose 11% sequentially to 329 kt.
“The production of saleable ore jumped 10% to 1.5 million tonnes.”

The updates indicate strong operational performance, although there is a decline in oil and gas production.
newTitle: Vedanta Announces Q3 Production Results: Aluminium Up 3%, Zinc Down 2%

title: ITC Hotels Demerger: Your Last Chance To Buy ITC Shares Before ITC Hotels Listing; Details - News18
Mukesh Ambani reveals 5 ‘gems’ of Jamnagar at 25th anniversary celebrations - The Economic Times
Zepto may file for IPO by March-April; eyes Singapore nod for moving India domicile - The Economic Times
EPFO begins centralised PF pension disbursal - The Hindu
summary:
EPFO begins centralised PF pension disbursal

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Employees’ Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) has implemented a new Centralised Pension Payments System (CPPS) aimed at streamlining the pension disbursal process, impacting over 68 lakh pensioners.

  • The CPPS is designed to facilitate seamless pension access from any bank across the country.
  • A total of ₹1,570 crore has been disbursed for December 2024.
  • The rollout includes 122 pension disbursing regional offices.
  • The pilot testing initiative was carried out in late 2024.
  • The system eliminates the need for physical verification visits for pensioners.
“This transformative initiative empowers pensioners to access their pension seamlessly from any bank, any branch, anywhere in the country.” - Mansukh Mandaviya, Union Labour Minister

The launch of the CPPS represents a significant advancement in the pension disbursement system, ensuring efficiency and accessibility for millions of pensioners.
newTitle: EPFO begins centralised PF pension disbursal
